DataElement.preferredName: Notification Performed Study Activity Variance Type Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed activity within the context of a given study that represents the communication of a message to a recipient. A coded value specifying the kind of variance. EXAMPLE(S): early / late occurrence of an act, higher / lower amount transferred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Notification Performed Study Activity Variance Type Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Informing by words.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._A statistical computation dervied by using the expected value and averaging the squared distance of all viable values.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Informing by words.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statistical computation dervied by using the expected value and averaging the squared distance of all viable values.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the variability in a sample or population. It is calculated as the mean squared deviation (MSD) of the individual values from their common mean. In calculating the MSD, the divisor n is commonly used for a population variance and the divisor n-1 for a sample variance.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
